Claim the Employee Retention Credit Now!

Home Services ERC

What is the Employee Retention Credit (ERC)?

During Covid-19 pandemic to support the affected businesses government announce the ERC(employee retention credit). ERC is stimulus program in form of a grant its not a loan so businesses who qualify for this employee retention credit will not have to return any thing back to IRS.

During Covid-19 pandemic to support the affected businesses government announce the ERC(employee retention credit). ERC is stimulus program in form of a grant its not a loan so businesses who qualify for this employee retention credit will not have to return any thing back to IRS.

Watch The Video

Do you know how much money can you get back as a tax credit from this ERC grant program?

  • The definition of qualified wages depends on how many employees an eligible employer has. For tax year 2020, eligible small businesses can claim 50% of the first $10,000 in wages per employee through the Employee Retention Credit. This adds up to a maximum of $5,000 per employee, which can benefit your business now.

  • For the first 3 quarters of 2021, eligible small businesses can claim up to 70% of the first $10,000 in wages per quarter for each employee. This amounts to $21,000 per employee.

  • In total, a small business could potentially receive $26,000 in credits per employee kept hired through 2020 and 2021.

Why You Need Our Help

  • ERC calculation is complex due to strict eligibility criteria.

  • ERC requires consideration of PPP loan funding benefit and qualifying wedges calculation

  • ERC regulations has been changing regularly and our certified professionals are here to help you with upto-date guidelines

  • As this is new and complex program our experienced staff dedicated to your ERC application will be there to assist you with every step of claim.

  • As ERC is relatively new program offering grant by government, not all the CPA are specialized or able to get maximum qualified benefits to your business.

  • Our specialist will be available to answer all the questions, till you get your eligible maximum benefit
